trans-unit.source: Getting to know the devices that support Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps will help you offer the best user experience for each form factor.
trans-unit.target: Getting to know the devices that support Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps will help you offer the best user experience for each form factor.

trans-unit.source: Device primer for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Device primer for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: Device primer for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Device primer for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Getting to know the devices that support Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps will help you offer the best user experience for each form factor.
trans-unit.target: Getting to know the devices that support Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps will help you offer the best user experience for each form factor.

trans-unit.source: When designing for a particular device, the main considerations include how the app will appear on that device, where, when, and how the app will be used on that device, and how the user will interact with that device.
trans-unit.target: When designing for a particular device, the main considerations include how the app will appear on that device, where, when, and how the app will be used on that device, and how the user will interact with that device.

trans-unit.source: The most widely-used of all computing devices, phones can do a lot with limited screen real estate and basic inputs.
trans-unit.target: The most widely-used of all computing devices, phones can do a lot with limited screen real estate and basic inputs.

trans-unit.source: Phones are available in a variety of sizes; larger phones are called phablets.
trans-unit.target: Phones are available in a variety of sizes; larger phones are called phablets.

trans-unit.source: App experiences on phablets are similar to those on phones, but the increased screen real estate of phablets enable some key changes in content consumption.
trans-unit.target: App experiences on phablets are similar to those on phones, but the increased screen real estate of phablets enable some key changes in content consumption.

trans-unit.source: With Continuum for Phones, a new experience for compatible Windows 10 mobile devices, users can connect their phones to a monitor and even use a mouse and keyboard to make their phones work like a laptop.
trans-unit.target: With Continuum for Phones, a new experience for compatible Windows 10 mobile devices, users can connect their phones to a monitor and even use a mouse and keyboard to make their phones work like a laptop.

trans-unit.source: (For more info, see the [Continuum for Phone article](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=699431).)
trans-unit.target: (For more info, see the [Continuum for Phone article](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=699431).)

trans-unit.source: Primarily used in portrait orientation, mostly due to the ease of holding the phone with one hand and being able to fully interact with it that way, but there are some experiences that work well in landscape, such as viewing photos and video, reading a book, and composing text.
trans-unit.target: Primarily used in portrait orientation, mostly due to the ease of holding the phone with one hand and being able to fully interact with it that way, but there are some experiences that work well in landscape, such as viewing photos and video, reading a book, and composing text.

trans-unit.source: Mostly used by just one person, the owner of the device.
trans-unit.target: Mostly used by just one person, the owner of the device.

trans-unit.source: Always within reach, usually stashed in a pocket or a bag.
trans-unit.target: Always within reach, usually stashed in a pocket or a bag.

trans-unit.source: Used for brief periods of time.
trans-unit.target: Used for brief periods of time.

trans-unit.source: Users are often multitasking when using the phone.
trans-unit.target: Users are often multitasking when using the phone.

trans-unit.source: Text is entered in short bursts.
trans-unit.target: Text is entered in short bursts.

trans-unit.source: The small size of a phone's screen allows only one frame at a time to be viewed in both portrait and landscape orientations.
trans-unit.target: The small size of a phone's screen allows only one frame at a time to be viewed in both portrait and landscape orientations.

trans-unit.source: All hierarchical navigation patterns on a phone use the "drill" model, with the user navigating through single-frame UI layers.
trans-unit.target: All hierarchical navigation patterns on a phone use the "drill" model, with the user navigating through single-frame UI layers.

trans-unit.source: Similar to phones, phablets in portrait mode can view only one frame at a time.
trans-unit.target: Similar to phones, phablets in portrait mode can view only one frame at a time.

trans-unit.source: But with the greater screen real estate available on a phablet, users have the ability to rotate to landscape orientation and stay there, so two app frames can be visible at a time.
trans-unit.target: But with the greater screen real estate available on a phablet, users have the ability to rotate to landscape orientation and stay there, so two app frames can be visible at a time.

trans-unit.source: In both landscape and portrait orientations, be sure that there's enough screen real estate for the app bar when the on-screen keyboard is up.
trans-unit.target: In both landscape and portrait orientations, be sure that there's enough screen real estate for the app bar when the on-screen keyboard is up.

trans-unit.source: Ultra-portable tablet computers are equipped with touchscreens, cameras, microphones, and accelerometers.
trans-unit.target: Ultra-portable tablet computers are equipped with touchscreens, cameras, microphones, and accelerometers.

trans-unit.source: Tablet screen sizes usually range from 7” to 13.3”.
trans-unit.target: Tablet screen sizes usually range from 7” to 13.3”.

trans-unit.source: About 80% of tablet use is by the owner, with the other 20% being shared use.
trans-unit.target: About 80% of tablet use is by the owner, with the other 20% being shared use.

trans-unit.source: It’s most commonly used at home as a companion device while watching TV.
trans-unit.target: It’s most commonly used at home as a companion device while watching TV.

trans-unit.source: It’s used for longer periods than phones and phablets.
trans-unit.target: It’s used for longer periods than phones and phablets.

trans-unit.source: Text is entered in short bursts.
trans-unit.target: Text is entered in short bursts.

trans-unit.source: In both landscape and portrait orientations, tablets allow two frames at a time.
trans-unit.target: In both landscape and portrait orientations, tablets allow two frames at a time.

trans-unit.source: System back is located on the navigation bar.
trans-unit.target: System back is located on the navigation bar.

trans-unit.source: Windows PCs and laptops include a wide array of devices and screen sizes.
trans-unit.target: Windows PCs and laptops include a wide array of devices and screen sizes.

trans-unit.source: In general, PCs and laptops can display more info than phone or tablets.
trans-unit.target: In general, PCs and laptops can display more info than phone or tablets.

trans-unit.source: Apps on desktops and laptops see shared use, but by one user at a time, and usually for longer periods.
trans-unit.target: Apps on desktops and laptops see shared use, but by one user at a time, and usually for longer periods.

trans-unit.source: Apps can have a windowed view, the size of which is determined by the user.
trans-unit.target: Apps can have a windowed view, the size of which is determined by the user.

trans-unit.source: Depending on window size, there can be between one and three frames.
trans-unit.target: Depending on window size, there can be between one and three frames.

trans-unit.source: On larger monitors, the app can have more than three frames.
trans-unit.target: On larger monitors, the app can have more than three frames.

trans-unit.source: When using an app on a desktop or laptop, the user has control over app files.
trans-unit.target: When using an app on a desktop or laptop, the user has control over app files.

trans-unit.source: As an app designer, be sure to provide the mechanisms to manage your app’s content.
trans-unit.target: As an app designer, be sure to provide the mechanisms to manage your app’s content.

trans-unit.source: Consider including commands and features such as "Save As", "Recent files", and so on.
trans-unit.target: Consider including commands and features such as "Save As", "Recent files", and so on.

trans-unit.source: When an app developer chooses to show it, it appears in the app title bar.
trans-unit.target: When an app developer chooses to show it, it appears in the app title bar.

trans-unit.source: Touch on laptops and all-in-one desktops.
trans-unit.target: Touch on laptops and all-in-one desktops.

trans-unit.source: Gamepads, such as the Xbox controller, are sometimes used.
trans-unit.target: Gamepads, such as the Xbox controller, are sometimes used.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Surface Hub is large-screen team collaboration device designed for simultaneous use by multiple users.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Surface Hub is large-screen team collaboration device designed for simultaneous use by multiple users.

trans-unit.source: Apps on Surface Hub see shared use for short periods of time, such as in meetings.
trans-unit.target: Apps on Surface Hub see shared use for short periods of time, such as in meetings.

trans-unit.source: Surface Hub devices are mostly stationary and rarely moved.
trans-unit.target: Surface Hub devices are mostly stationary and rarely moved.

trans-unit.source: Apps on Surface Hub can appear in one of four states - fill (a fixed view that occupies the available stage area, full (standard full-screen view), snapped (variable view that occupies the right or left sides of the stage) and background (hidden from view while the app is still running, available in task switcher).
trans-unit.target: Apps on Surface Hub can appear in one of four states - fill (a fixed view that occupies the available stage area, full (standard full-screen view), snapped (variable view that occupies the right or left sides of the stage) and background (hidden from view while the app is still running, available in task switcher).

trans-unit.source: In snapped mode or fill modes, the system displays the Skype sidebar and shrinks the app horizontally.
trans-unit.target: In snapped mode or fill modes, the system displays the Skype sidebar and shrinks the app horizontally.

trans-unit.source: When an app developer chooses to show it, it appears in the app title bar.
trans-unit.target: When an app developer chooses to show it, it appears in the app title bar.

trans-unit.source: Windows IoT devices are an emerging class of devices centered around embedding small electronics, sensors, and connectivity within physical objects.
trans-unit.target: Windows IoT devices are an emerging class of devices centered around embedding small electronics, sensors, and connectivity within physical objects.

trans-unit.source: These devices are usually connected through a network or the Internet to report on the real-world data they sense, and in some cases act on it.
trans-unit.target: These devices are usually connected through a network or the Internet to report on the real-world data they sense, and in some cases act on it.

trans-unit.source: Devices can either have no screen (also known as “headless” devices) or are connected to a small screen (known as “headed” devices) with a screen size usually 3.5” or smaller.
trans-unit.target: Devices can either have no screen (also known as “headless” devices) or are connected to a small screen (known as “headed” devices) with a screen size usually 3.5” or smaller.

trans-unit.source: Usually connected through a network or the Internet to report on the real-world data they sense, and in some cases act on it.
trans-unit.target: Usually connected through a network or the Internet to report on the real-world data they sense, and in some cases act on it.

trans-unit.source: These devices can only run one application at a time unlike phones or other larger devices.
trans-unit.target: These devices can only run one application at a time unlike phones or other larger devices.

trans-unit.source: It isn’t something that is interacted with all the time, but instead is available when you need it, out of the way when you don’t.
trans-unit.target: It isn’t something that is interacted with all the time, but instead is available when you need it, out of the way when you don’t.

trans-unit.source: App doesn’t have a dedicated back affordance, that is the developers responsibility.
trans-unit.target: App doesn’t have a dedicated back affordance, that is the developers responsibility.

trans-unit.source: Display for “headed” devices is minimal, only showing what is necessary due to limited screen real estate and functionality.
trans-unit.target: Display for “headed” devices is minimal, only showing what is necessary due to limited screen real estate and functionality.

trans-unit.source: Orientation is most times locked, so your app only needs to consider one display direction.
trans-unit.target: Orientation is most times locked, so your app only needs to consider one display direction.

trans-unit.source: This article contains information that is specific to UWP apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: This article contains information that is specific to UWP apps and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
